title: Trump Tells Japan It Can Protect Itself by Buying U.S. Arms
abstract: President Trump was by turns generous and challenging as he pressed Japan on shooting down North Korean missiles and on trade imbalances with the United States.
byline: By MARK LANDLER and JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS

multimedia.caption: Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan received President Trump on Monday at Akasaka Palace in Tokyo, accompanied by a military honor guard.

title: Ritz-Carlton Has Become a Gilded Cage for Saudi Royals
abstract: An opulent hotel in Riyadh, the Saudi capital, is being used to house people detained in what Saudi Arabia’s government calls a crackdown on corruption.

title: Wooing Trump, Xi Jinping Seeks Great Power Status for China
abstract: Mr. Xi, the most powerful Chinese leader in decades, wants the United States to share global leadership with China as equals.
byline: By JANE PERLEZ and MARK LANDLER

multimedia.caption: An exhibition in Beijing last month highlighted China’s achievements under Xi Jinping, who has projected China as a stable and rich nation, willing to take on the obligations of a major power.

title: In Russian City, a Time Capsule to Comrades of the Future
abstract: On the 50th anniversary of the Russian Revolution, the youth of 1967 sent a message to those of 2017: “Stay true to Communism’s ideals.”

title: Assault in Taj Mahal Country Shakes India’s Tourist Trade
abstract: An attack on a Swiss couple has increased anxieties in an area whose monuments, left by the Muslim Mughals, displease some powerful Hindu nationalists.
byline: By KAI SCHULTZ and SUHASINI RAJ

multimedia.caption: The Taj Mahal in Agra, India, in 2012. Some Hindu nationalists have denounced the Muslim monument as built by “traitors” who “wanted to wipe out Hindus.”

title: Saudi Arabia Charges Iran With ‘Act of War,’ Raising Threat of Military Clash
abstract: Saudi Arabia’s claim that a missile fired from Yemen was provided by Iran escalates tensions between the regional powers, who are fighting proxy wars in Yemen, Syria and Iraq.

title: From Utah, Secretive Help for a Russian Oligarch and His Jet
abstract: Records leaked from an offshore law firm show how the wealthy elite sidestep prohibitions on foreigners registering private planes in the United States.

multimedia.caption: Leonid Mikhelson, Russia’s richest oligarch, used Bank of Utah as a stand-in so he could register his Gulfstream jet in the United States, which requires citizenship or residency.

title: Berlusconi’s Comeback Hopes Buoyed by Sicily Election Results
abstract: Voters gave strong backing to center-right and populist parties, setting the stage for national elections next year.

title: ‘We Are Everywhere’: How Ethiopia Became a Land of Prying Eyes

title: Slovakia Deals Setback to Neo-Fascist Candidate

title: Puigdemont and Other Catalonia Separatists Report to Belgian Police
abstract: A judge had issued international warrants for the five members of Mr. Puigdemont’s now-deposed government, all of whom were in Belgium.

multimedia.caption: The deposed Catalan leader, Carles Puigdemont, and other former officials at a news conference in Brussels last month.

title: Trump Tells Saudi King That He Supports Modernization Drive
abstract: In a phone call, President Trump praised Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, who is thought to be behind a sweeping campaign of arrests.

title: Guy Fawkes Failed. But in the U.K., He Still Has His Night.
abstract: More than 400 years after his capture ended a plot to kill the king of England, his name and face are part of the culture in Britain and worldwide.

multimedia.caption: An effigy of Guy Fawkes in a procession in Lewes, England, in 2012 for the anniversary of a failed plot to blow up Parliament in London in 1605.

title: Citigroup, Twitter, Lyft: Prince’s Arrest Touches Many
abstract: Prince Alwaleed’s arrest is likely to reverberate across dozens of publicly listed companies that count him as a major investor.
byline: By ALEXANDRA STEVENSON, ANNE BARNARD and NEIL MacFARQUHAR

title: Trump Opens Asia Trip Talking Tough in Campaign-Style Rally
abstract: President Trump promoted American military might and his own domestic record as he arrived in Japan to start a 12-day, five-country tour through Asia.
geo_facet: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas

multimedia.caption: President Trump spoke Sunday at Yokota Air Base in Japan at the beginning of a 12-day, five-country trip through Asia. He told American troops, “You are the greatest threat to tyrants and dictators who seek to prey on the innocent.”
